change.changenote: Section 1 definition of "public distributed learning school" was added by BC Reg 172/2012, effective June 25, 2012.
Section 2 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 259/2010, effective September 10, 2010.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsection (3), in order to qualify for a grant under the Act in respect of an independent school, an authority holding a group 1 or 2 certificate for the independent school must file the following with the inspector:

paragraph.paragraphtext: by October 15 of the school year for which a grant is claimed, a report, in the form specified by the inspector, stating

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the number of eligible students enrolled in and in attendance at the school as of September 30 of that school year in an educational program that is not delivered through distributed learning,

the number of eligible students enrolled at the school as of September 30 of that school year who are in kindergarten and grades 1 to 9 in an educational program delivered in whole or in part through distributed learning, and
the total number of eligible students enrolled at the school in each grade 10 to 12 course delivered through distributed learning as of September 30 of that school year, multiplied by 1/8;

paragraph.paragraphtext: by February 28 of the school year for which a grant is claimed, a report, in the form specified by the inspector, stating

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the number of eligible students enrolled in the school after September 30 of that school year but on or before February 15 who are in kindergarten and grades 1 to 9 in an educational program delivered in whole or in part through distributed learning, multiplied by 1/2, and

the total number of eligible students enrolled at the school in each grade 10 to 12 course delivered through distributed learning after September 30 of that school year but on or before February 15, multiplied by 1/8;

paragraph.paragraphtext: by May 31 of the school year for which a grant is claimed, a report, in the form specified by the inspector, stating

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the number of eligible students enrolled in the school after February 15 of that school year but on or before May 15 who are in kindergarten and grades 1 to 9 in an educational program delivered in whole or in part through distributed learning, multiplied by 1/3, and

the total number of eligible students enrolled at the school in each grade 10 to 12 course delivered through distributed learning after February 15 of that school year but on or before May 15, multiplied by 1/8;

paragraph.paragraphtext: by June 15 of the school year for which a grant is claimed, an audited report, in the form specified by the inspector, stating

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the number of eligible students enrolled in and in attendance at the school as of May 15 who have completed at least 600 hours of instruction after July 1 but before May 15 of that school year in an educational program that is not delivered through distributed learning,

the number of eligible students enrolled in and in attendance at the school as of May 15 who have completed fewer than 600 hours of instruction after July 1 but before May 15 of that school year in an educational program that is not delivered through distributed learning, and
the total number of hours of instruction received through the school by the students referred to in subparagraph (ii), divided by 600.

change.changenote: Section 2 (1.1) was added by BC Reg 259/2010, effective September 10, 2010.
Section 2 (1.1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 90/2011, effective July 1, 2011.

paragraph.paragraphtext: kindergarten students enrolled in an independent school listed in column 2 of Appendix 1 are classified as

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: FTE kindergarten students up to the number of full-day kindergarten spaces allocated to that independent school in column 3 of Appendix 1, if the students are enrolled in an educational program that offers at least 850 hours of instruction,
1/2 FTE kindergarten students if the students are enrolled in an educational program that offers fewer than 850 hours of instruction, or

1/2 FTE kindergarten students in excess of the number of full-day kindergarten spaces allocated to that independent school in column 3 of Appendix 1 regardless of how many hours of instruction the students are offered in their educational program, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: kindergarten students enrolled in an independent school not listed in column 2 of Appendix 1 are classified as 1/2 FTE kindergarten students.

change.changenote: Section 2 (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 172/2012, effective June 25, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: Where the inspector accepts the filing of a report after the date it is due under subsections (1) and (2), the report shall be deemed to be filed on time for the purposes of subsection (1) or (2), as the case may be.

change.changenote: Section 2 (2.1) and (2.2) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 125/2014, effective June 23, 2014.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Except in respect of an eligible student enrolled in an educational program in any of grades 10 to 12 that is delivered in whole or in part through distributed learning, a grant must not be paid to an authority with respect to a student enrolled in an educational program provided by a board.

Except in respect of an eligible student enrolled in more than one educational program in any of grades 10 to 12 delivered in whole or in part through distributed learning, only one grant will be paid with respect to a student enrolled in more than one independent school or enrolled in more than one educational program offered by the same independent school.

change.changenote: Section 2 (4) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 221/2016, effective September 20, 2016.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A report referred to in subsection (1) (d) or subsection (2) must be audited by a person qualified under section 205 of the Business Corporations Act to be an auditor of a reporting company.

change.changenote: Section 2 (4) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 221/2016, effective November 28, 2016.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A report referred to in subsection (1) (d) or subsection (2) must be audited by a person qualified under section 42 of the Society Act to be an auditor of a reporting society.

change.changenote: Section 2.1 was enacted by BC Reg 92/2020, effective April 30, 2020.
Section 2.1 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 79/2022, effective March 30, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of applying section 2 (1) (d) in relation to the school year commencing July 1, 2019,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in that provision, the reference to "June 15" is to be read as a reference to "May 1" and the reference to "an audited report" is to be read as a reference to "a report",
in subparagraphs (i), (ii), (iii) and (iv) of that provision, a reference to "May 15" is to be read as a reference to "March 15",
in subparagraphs (i) and (iii) of that provision, a reference to "600 hours of instruction" is to be read as a reference to "450 hours of instruction",
in subparagraphs (ii) and (iv) of that provision, a reference to "320 hours of instruction" is to be read as a reference to "240 hours of instruction",
in subparagraph (v) of that provision, the reference to "divided by 600" is to be read as a reference to "divided by 450", and
in subparagraph (vi) of that provision, the reference to "divided by 320" is to be read as a reference to "divided by 240".

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite section 2 (1.1), for the purposes of applying section 2 (1) (d) as modified by this section, kindergarten students enrolled in an independent school in an educational program that is not delivered through distributed learning, are classified as

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: FTE kindergarten students if the students are enrolled in an educational program that offers at least 450 hours of instruction, and
1/2 FTE kindergarten students if the students are enrolled in an educational program that offers fewer than 450 hours of instruction.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For greater certainty, section 2 (4) does not apply to a report referred to in section 2 (1) (d) as modified by this section.

In applying section 3 (1) (a) for the purposes of the school year commencing July 1, 2019, the reference in that provision to "section 2 (1) (d) (i), (ii), (v) and (vi)" is to be read as a reference to section 2 (1) (d) (i), (ii), (v) and (vi) as modified by this section.

change.changenote: Section 3 (1) (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 259/2010, effective September 10, 2010.

paragraph.paragraphtext: the total sum of the amounts described in section 2 (1) (a) (ii) and (iii), (b) (i) and (ii), (c) (i) and (ii) and (d) (i) and (iii),

change.changenote: Section 3 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 172/2012, effective June 25, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purposes of section 12 (1) of the Act, a grant for a school year to an authority for each group 1 or 2 classification independent school it operates is the product of the following:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the total sum of the amounts described in section 2 (1) (a) (ii), (iii) and (iv), (b) (i), (ii) and (iii), (c) (i), (ii) and (iii) and (d) (i), (ii), (v) and (vi),
the per FTE student grant for the school year of the public school district in which the independent school is located, and
the percentage applicable to the school under section 4.

subsection.subsectiontext: No grant shall be paid to an authority with respect to a student whose education is fully or substantially funded by the government of Canada.
The per FTE student grant in subsection (1) (b) shall be calculated by the following formula:

section.subsandwich: where, in relation to the public school district,

tablerow.tablecol: the amount of the operating grant under section 106.3 of the School Act, and

if in the school year a special grant is payable under section 115 (1) (a) of the School Act to all boards of all public school districts in the Province for operating expenses, the amount of that special grant paid to the public school district;
is the "annual facility grant" as defined in section 1 of the School Act;
is the total for local capital expenditures as defined by paragraph (b) of the definition of "local capital expenditure" in section 1 of the School Act;
is the allocation by the minister made under section 106.3 (1) (b) of the School Act in respect of students eligible for supplementary special needs funding;
is the number of the school district's FTE students as determined as of September 30 of the school year by the minister.

change.changenote: Section 3 (4) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 125/2013, effective July 1, 2013.

subsection.subsectiontext: The per FTE student grant in subsection (1) (b) must be calculated using the following formula:

change.subsandwich: where, in relation to the school district,

tablerow.tablecol: the amount of the operating grant under section 106.3 of the School Act for the school year, estimated by the minister as of December 30 of the school year;

if in the school year a special grant is payable under section 115 (1) (a) of the School Act to all boards of all school districts in the Province for operating expenses, the amount of that special grant paid to the school district;

the allocation by the minister made under section 106.3 of the School Act in respect of students eligible for supplementary special needs funding for the school year, estimated by the minister as of December 30 of the school year;
the number of the school district's FTE students for the school year, estimated by the minister as of December 30 of the school year.

change.changenote: Section 3 (6) and (7) were added by BC Reg 125/2014, effective June 23, 2014.
Section 4 (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 259/2010, effective September 10, 2010.

paragraph.paragraphtext: 100% for an independent school listed in the Appendix,

change.changenote: Section 4 (b) (ii) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 259/2010, effective September 10, 2010.

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: that is not listed in the Appendix, and

change.changenote: Section 4 (c) (ii) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 259/2010, effective September 10, 2010.

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: that is not listed in the Appendix.

change.changenote: Section 4 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 172/2012, effective June 25, 2012.

section.sectiontext: The percentage that is applicable for the purposes of section 3 (1) (c) for the school year commencing July 1, 2009 and for each subsequent school year is

change.changenote: Section 4.1 was enacted by BC Reg 172/2012, effective June 25, 2012.
Section 4.1 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 125/2013, effective July 1, 2013.

section.sectiontext: The percentage that is applicable in respect of a distributed learning independent school for the purposes of section 3 (2) (c) for the school year commencing July 1, 2012 and for each subsequent school year is

paragraph.paragraphtext: 62% for a distributed learning independent school for which an authority has been issued a certificate of group 1 classification, and
43.4% for a distributed learning independent school for which an authority has been issued a certificate of group 2 classification.

change.changenote: Section 4.1 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 97/2020, effective July 1, 2020.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The percentage that is applicable in respect of a distributed learning independent school for the purposes of section 3 (2) (c) for the school year commencing July 1, 2013 and for each subsequent school year is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 63% for a distributed learning independent school for which an authority has been issued a certificate of group 1 classification, and
44.1% for a distributed learning independent school for which an authority has been issued a certificate of group 2 classification.

change.changenote: Section 5 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 172/2012, effective June 25, 2012.

section.marginalnote: Expiry of certificate of group classification
section.sectiontext: A certificate of group classification for an independent school shall be granted for a term not exceeding

change.changenote: Section 6 (1) (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 172/2012, effective June 25, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: shall offer, free of charge, the evaluation and assessment services normally offered to students by the independent school in which the child is registered, and

change.changenote: Section 6 (1) (b) (i) and (ii) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 64/2021, effective March 11, 2021.

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: authorized and recommended educational resource materials provided by the Ministry of Education that, in the school's opinion, are sufficient to enable the child to pursue his or her educational program, or
learning materials used by the students of the independent school that, in the school's opinion, are sufficient to enable the child to pursue his or her educational program.

change.changenote: Section 8 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 172/2012, effective June 25, 2012.

section.marginalnote: Authority to provide information about bond
section.sectiontext: An authority holding a group 4 certificate for an independent school shall include in its school calendar detailed information concerning the protection afforded by a bond acquired by the authority pursuant to the Bonding Regulation.

change.changenote: Section 8 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 221/2016, effective September 20, 2016.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Authority to provide information about bond
bcl:section.bcl:text: An authority holding a group 4 certificate for an independent school must include in its school calendar detailed information concerning the protection afforded by a bond acquired by the authority pursuant to the Bonding Regulation.

change.changenote: Section 11 was enacted by BC Reg 206/2014, effective November 24, 2014.
Section 11 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 262/89, effective July 1, 2015.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite section 2, for the purposes of applying section 2 (1) to the 2014/2015 school year,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the reference to "October 15 of the school year for which a grant is claimed" must be read as a reference to "November 30, 2014", and
all references to "September 30 of that school year" must be read as references to "October 17, 2014".

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite section 3, for the purposes of applying section 3 (4) and (5) to the 2014/2015 school year, the references to "September 30 of the school year" must be read as references to "October 17, 2014".
This section is repealed on July 1, 2015.

change.changenote: Section 12 was enacted by BC Reg 221/2016, effective September 20, 2016.
Section 13 was enacted by BC Reg 221/2016, effective September 20, 2016.
Section 13 (3) (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 221/2016, effective November 28, 2016.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the authority is a society incorporated under the Society Act or a company incorporated under the Business Corporations Act and provides the inspector with a certificate of good standing issued by or on behalf of the Registrar of Companies, not more than 30 days before the application;

change.changenote: Section 14 was enacted by BC Reg 221/2016, effective September 20, 2016.
Section 15 was enacted by BC Reg 221/2016, effective September 20, 2016.
Section 16 was enacted by BC Reg 221/2016, effective September 20, 2016.
Section 17 was enacted by BC Reg 221/2016, effective September 20, 2016.
Section 17 (3) and (4) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 221/2016, effective September 2, 2017.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (2) of this section and section 8 of the Bonding Regulations, for the period of time that starts on the date this section comes into force and ends on September 1, 2017, acceptable security for a bond for the purposes of the Act must consist of one or more of the following types of security:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: short term deposits, not to exceed 3 years, issued by a savings institution and registered in the name of the minister, the interest from which may be payable to the depositor;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in fully registered form, issued or guaranteed by the government of Canada or the government of a province, with a maturity date of not longer than 3 years, and
accompanied by a duly executed, irrevocable power of attorney that authorizes the minister to realize the security;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: treasury bill notes issued by the government of Canada or the government of a province;

irrevocable letters of credit, issued by a savings institution, with a termination date beyond the required term of security and containing a promise to pay the minister a specified sum on written demand;
surety bonds issued by a person authorized under the Financial Institutions Act to carry on insurance business.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (3) and this subsection are repealed on September 2, 2017.

Appendix 1 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 90/2011, effective July 1, 2011.
